intro: Pterocaulon interruptum var. monostachyum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is considered a species of conservation interest.
